title: Marilena Barbera 2015 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)
description: This 100% Nero d'Avola has blue flower, black-skinned berry and Mediterranean scrub aromas. It's easygoing and juicy, offering black cherry and white pepper flavors alongside round tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: François Millet 2016  Sancerre
description: This is a soft, easygoing style from the Millets, now in their third generation in Sancerre. With attractive white stone fruits and a citrus streak, the wine has delicious refreshing acidity and a light bright aftertaste. Drink now.

title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Romantic Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de France)
description: This oddly named Cabernet Sauvignon is fine. It has light tannins, a juicy, stalky character, upfront black currant fruit and balanced acidity. Drink now.

title: Real Companhia Velha 2016 Porca de Murça Branco White (Douro)
description: This delicious and refreshing wine comes from the plateau above the Douro Valley, giving it a cool character along with a mineral and spice texture. The wine is perfumed from the 20% Moscatel in the blend. Drink now.

title: Quevedo 2016 Oscar's White White (Douro)
description: A ripe, smooth wine made mainly from Viosinho and Gouveio, this is creamy-textured, rich with yellow fruits. It is cut by crisper acidity and a delicious, refreshing lemon-curd flavor. Drink now.

title: Twill 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This light, pleasant wine shows ripe strawberry, white pepper and dried herb notes. It was aged for 22 months in 10% new French oak.

title: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2016 Domaine Vetriccie White (Ile de Beauté)
description: The Chardonnay in this blend with Vermentino creates a smooth, unctuous texture. Acidity and richness combine to bring out citrus and apricot flavors. The end delivers a zesty, mineral tang. Drink now.
winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

title: Simple Machine 2013 The Vector Syrah-Grenache (Rogue Valley)
description: This blend of 60% Syrah and 40% Grenache blend is high in alcohol and ultra ripe with fruit. It's pushed well past any subtlety, with dark black fruit flavors, chewy tannins and some heat on the finish.

title: Solitary Cellars 2014 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Black plum, prune and vanilla show on the slightly metallic nose of this bottling. There is decent richness to the sip, with gingerbread spice and black-cherry flavors.

title: Spindrift Cellars 2015 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)
description: Quite ripe and fruity, this full-bodied wine brings apple, pear and peach fruit in abundance. It's almost over-the-top, with some noticeable heat on the finish.

title: Spindrift Cellars 2016 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: This is a solid, fruity, well-priced wine that brings pear and peach flesh and skin flavors. It was briefly barrel aged and is ready for near-term drinking.

title: Stemmari 2015 Pinot Nero (Sicilia)
description: Made entirely from Pinot Nero, this opens with red-skinned berry and cooking spice aromas. The bright, straightforward palate delivers strawberry and cinnamon notes, with smooth tannins and fresh acidity. Enjoy soon.

title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The production of this nationally-distributed wine almost doubled this vintage, making it one of the most visible Oregon Pinots in the country. It's medium bodied and offers good varietal character, but there is a slight off-note on the nose, which carries through the finish, albeit subtly.

title: Vite Colte 2014 La Casa in Collina  (Barbaresco)
description: This wine's crushed mint, menthol, underbrush and iris aromas carry over to its nervous, racy palate, along with tart cherry and unripe strawberry. Tightly wound tannins and firm acidity provide the lean framework.

title: Voerzio Martini 2015 Rocchettevino  (Dolcetto d'Alba)
description: The dark-skinned fruit, clove and chopped herb aromas in this wine are delicate. Its polished tannins support raw raspberry, sour cherry and ground pepper notes. Drink soon.

title: Sutcliffe 2013 Cabernet Franc (Colorado)
description: Aromas of plum, black currant and blackberry are heightened by dried cranberry, with hints of bell pepper and white pepper. Firm tannins on the palate are balanced by the acidity, with brambly flavors of blackberry and plenty of pepper. The tannins linger through the finish, with note of white pepper and bramble.

title: Sutcliffe 2014 Merlot (Colorado)
description: Black cherry and pomegranate shine through the smoke, licorice and cedar aromas. The medium-bodied palate is lightly smoky, with more notes of cedar and vanilla. Dark fruits persist, supported by soft, dusty tannins and a pleasant lift of acidity on the finish.

title: Saget la Perrière 2015 Domaine de Terres Blanches Alchimie Sauvignon Blanc (Coteaux du Giennois)
description: From a small appellation north of the Pouilly-Fumé region, this wine is lightly fruity. It has creamy acidity and a perfumed character that comes from the lemon and honey fruitiness. Drink now.

title: Thibault 2015 Fernand & Sons Sauvignon Blanc (Coteaux du Giennois)
description: Crisp and full of green apple and squeezed lemon juice, this is a fruity wine that has a tight edge of steely texture as a contrast. It is a fine, refreshing and tangy wine, hinting at minerality and ready to drink.

title: Cantine Povero 2014 Batù  (Barbaresco)
description: This wine's violet, baking spice and herb aromas carry over to its bright, straightforward palate together with sour cherry, pomegranate and a blast of orange zest. Bracing tannins and racy acidity, although assertive, provide support.

title: Carlo Giacosa 2014 Narin  (Barbaresco)
description: Sour berry, coconut and camphor aromas lead the way while the firm palate offers toast, vanilla, espresso and chocolate-covered cherry flavors. Grainy tannins grip the finish.

title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2016 Atlântico Red (Alentejano)
description: This lightly wood-aged wine is ripe, with some firm tannins and a dense structure. It is full of red-berry and spice flavors that are underscored by the dry tannins. Drink this balanced wine now.

title: Dois Irmãos 2015 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: Owing perhaps to its youth,this remains an uneasy mix of acid, oak, apple and citrus. It has strong components that are not entirely integrated. Another year or two in bottle would be a good idea.

title: Domaine Chatelain 2015 Jean Vincent  (Sancerre)
description: Soft and fruity, this bright lively wine is crisply refreshing. It has juicy acidity that is flavored with apple and grapefruit flavors. Tangy at the end, it is ready to drink.

title: Domaine Chatelain 2015 Vincent Vatan Sélection Silex  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: The wine comes from silex soil around the small village of Saint-Andelain. Crisply textured, it has vanilla and spice flavors to fill out the intense acidity. The aftertaste, still young, brings in a steely tight texture. Drink from 2018.

title: Domaine de la Coche 2016 La Salle aux Fées Sur Lie  (Muscadet Côtes de Grandlieu)
description: The wine comes from southwest of Nantes in the region around Lac de Grand-Lieu. It is a rounded style of wine, cut with some attractive acidity as well as apple fruitiness. Drink now.
designation: La Salle aux Fées Sur Lie

title: A Blooming Hill Vineyard 2016 Mingle White (Chehalem Mountains)
description: This smooth and easy-drinking wine blends 60% Pinot Gris with equal amounts of Chardonnay and Riesling. It's light blush in color, with hints of honey on both the nose and palate. A good, all-purpose white, it should be consumed over the next year or two.

title: Blue Valley 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Middleburg)
description: This wine starts off with a nose of fresh grass and subtle rosewater. These translate well on the palate, alongside additional hints of ginger and lemon. Tingling with acidity but thin in weight, the midpalate is slightly disjointed. A zing of citrus on the finish brings a bit of focus.

title: Domaine Girard 2016 Benoît Girard  (Sancerre)
description: This has a soft texture that just allows room for some crisp apple flavors. Otherwise, it is a smooth rounded wine. Its fruitiness and its acidity are part and parcel of this ripe wine. Drink now.

title: Domaine les Hautes Noëlles 2016 Les Parcelles Sur Lie  (Muscadet Côtes de Grandlieu)
description: This is all light fruit and crisp acidity. Bright and light, brimming with citrus and apples, the wine is ready to drink. It comes from the western end of the Muscadet vineyards near the Lac de Grand-Lieu.
